about_the_game:
[Game System]

This is a romance simulation game that progresses with just a click. You can choose where to go from the protagonist's dorm room and move around the map. By checking social media, you can try to encounter the girls and get closer to them emotionally. Attending classes will earn you experience points, which can be used to acquire special skills. These skills allow you to see the affection levels of the girls or hack into their private social media accounts to gain deeper insights.

[Story]

The main character, from the countryside, has made the decision to enroll in a college in Tokyo. The background to this is his yearning for the glittering urban lifestyle, and his strong desire to become “cool city boy” and to change his image of himself as a “country bumpkin”. In contrast to his life in the countryside, Tokyo is a world unknown to him. He is filled with anticipation. Little did he know that the difficulties of a new university life were waiting for him...

From the first day of school, the protagonist is used by the “positive” group of people living in the same dormitory.

He has never had a girlfriend, but he has decided that he will finally lose his virginity at college. However, there is an absolute theory in college life that if you can't make a girlfriend within the first month of entering college, you definitely won't be able to make one for the next four years. You must use every means at your disposal to interact with girls, become friends with them, and then take things to the next level. While investigating the actions and circumstances of the girls through SNS timelines and message apps, you must achieve your goal!

[About the mini-game "Hacking"]

Predict and enter the password based on the information provided in the four hints. The last hint contains a direct hint about the password.

Example Hint 1: Name is John. Born in 1990

Hint 2: The password consists of 4 letters + 4-digit numbers.

Password = John1990

This is how the game system works. Based on the given information, try several password patterns and derive the correct answer.
